title: China Upends the Weak Oil-Demand Narrative
summary: China’s latest oil import data has been rather bullish, with November imports rising 5% year on year. title: Canada Considers Major Pipeline Revival Amid U.S. Trade Tensions
summary: Canada could approve the development of a new oil pipeline, four years after plans for the cross-border Keystone XL Pipeline were scrapped over environmental and human rights concerns. title: How White Hydrogen and Carbon Mineralization Could Decarbonize Industry
summary: In the remote geology of western Newfoundland, a specific formation of ancient oceanic crust is shifting from a subject of academic study to a target for industrial decarbonization. title: The New Power Rules Driving Europe's Battery Storage Boom
summary: The economics of battery storage systems (BESS) in Europe look much rosier following changes to the European Union’s (EU) power pricing structure in October, with several countries offering the potential for BESS profits to rise more than a 15%, according to Rystad Energy analysis. title: US Drillers Add Oil Rigs As Analysts Warn of Incoming Glut
summary: The total number of active drilling rigs for oil and gas in the United States fell by 1 this week, according to new data that Baker Hughes published on Friday, bringing the total rig count in the US to 548 this week, according to Baker Hughes, down 41 from this same time last year.
